title: Scott Servais to become Mariners manager
text:
Servais with the Cubs in 1997. (Photo: AP)
8 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE The Seattle Mariners have hired Scott Servais as the club's new manager, according to a person with direct knowledge of the hiring. The person spoke to USA TODAY Sports on the condition of anonymity because the hiring had not yet been announced.
A former catcher, Servais played in the major leagues from 1991-2001 with the Astros, Cubs, Giants and Rockies.
Servais has a history with new Mariners general manager Jerry Dipoto, working under him as an assistant GM, managing scouting and development with the Los Angeles Angels. Dipoto left Los Angeles midway through the 2015 season and was hired by Seattle in September.
USA TODAY
Nightengale: Don Mattingly-Dodgers split shows GMs need 'their guys'
Servais replaces Lloyd McClendon, who was dismissed at the end of the season after going 163-161 in two years with the Mariners.
The person also said Tim Bogar, also under consideration for the Mariners' managerial job, will serve as Servais' bench coach.
Contributing: Bob Nightengale
